Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI)

title: Food Safety and Standards (Food Products Standards and Food Additives) Regulations, 2011

publication_details.gazette_reference: Gazette of India Extraordinary Part III – Sec. 4 dated 20th October 2010

enactment.exceptions: Regulations 2.1.7.(1)(2)(3)(4), 2.1.8 (1)(3), 2.1.11 (1)(2), 2.1.12(1), including table 14 of Appendix A and table 2 of Appendix B, shall come into force after six months from that date.
enactment.compliance_provisions: Food Business Operators with existing licenses must comply within six months of the regulations' commencement.

title_and_commencement.title: Food Safety and Standards (Food Products Standards and Food Additives) Regulations, 2011

definitions.BOILED MILK: Milk which has been brought to boil.
definitions.De-oiled meal: The residual material left over when oil is extracted by a solvent from any oil-bearing material.
definitions.DOUBLE TONED MILK: Product prepared by admixture of cow or buffalo milk or both with fresh skimmed milk, or by admixture of cow or buffalo milk or both that has been standardised to specific fat and solids-not-fat percentages. It shall be pasteurised and show a negative Phosphatase Test.
definitions.Hydrogenation: The process of addition of hydrogen to an edible vegetable oil using a catalyst to produce a fat with semi-solid consistency.
definitions.Flavoured Milk: May contain nuts, chocolate, coffee, edible flavour, edible food colours and cane sugar. Must be pasteurised, sterilised or boiled. Type of milk must be mentioned on the label.
definitions.Full Cream Milk: Milk or a combination of buffalo or cow milk or both, standardised to specific fat and solids-not-fat percentages. It shall be pasteurised and show a negative phosphatase test.
definitions.Irradiation: Any physical procedure involving the intentional exposure of food to ionizing radiations.
definitions.Irradiation facility: Any facility which is capable of being utilized for treatment of food by irradiation.
definitions.Irradiated food: Articles of food subjected to radiation by Gamma Rays, X-rays, or Sub-atomic particles to dose levels specified in Schedule I of the Atomic Energy (Control of Irradiation of Food) Rules 1991.
definitions.MILK: The normal mammary secretion derived from complete milking of healthy milch animal without either addition thereto or extraction therefrom. It shall be free from colostrum and urea content shall not be more than 700 ppm.
definitions.MIXED MILK: A combination of milk of cow, buffalo, sheep, goat or any other milch animal, conforming to specified standards.
definitions.MILK PRODUCTS: Products obtained from milk such as cream, curd, cheese, ice-cream, etc. Shall not contain any substance not found in milk unless specified.
definitions.Margarine: An emulsion of edible oils and fats with water.
definitions.Operator of irradiation facility: Any person appointed by a licensee who satisfies the qualifications and requirements specified in Schedule II of the Atomic Energy (Control of Irradiation of Food) Rules, 1991.
definitions.PASTEURISATION: Process of heating milk to at least 63°C for 30 minutes or 71.5°C for 15 seconds, or an approved time-temperature combination to give a negative Phosphatase Test. Pasteurized milk must be cooled to 10°C or less.
definitions.RECOMBINED MILK: Homogenised product prepared from milk fat, non-fat-milk solids and water. Shall be pasteurised and show a negative Phosphatase test.
definitions.Refined vegetable oil: Any vegetable oil obtained by expression or solvent extraction and refined using specified methods.
definitions.Refining: Process of deacidifying an expressed or solvent-extracted vegetable oil followed by bleaching and deodorizing.
definitions.SKIMMED MILK: The product prepared from milk from which almost all the milk fat has been removed mechanically.
definitions.STERILISATION: Heating milk in sealed containers to 115°C for 15 minutes or 130°C for at least one second and then packed under aseptic conditions.
definitions.STANDARDISED MILK: Cow or buffalo or sheep or goat milk or a combination thereof standardised to specified fat and solids-not-fat percentages. Shall be pasteurised and show a negative Phosphatase Test.
definitions.Solvent-extracted oil: Any vegetable oil obtained from oil-bearing material by the process of extraction by a solvent.
definitions.Solvent-extracted edible flour: The ground material obtained from specially prepared deoiled meal.
definitions.TONED MILK: Product prepared by admixture of cow or buffalo milk or both with fresh skimmed milk, standardised to specified fat and solids-not-fat percentages. Shall be pasteurised and show a negative Phosphatase Test.
definitions.Vegetable oils: Oils produced from oilcakes or oilseeds or oil-bearing materials of plant origin and containing glycerides.
definitions.Vegetable oil product: Any product obtained for edible purposes by subjecting one or more edible oils to processes like refining, blending, hydrogenation or interesterification and winterization.

milk.title: Standards of different classes and designations of milk
notes: When milk is offered for sale without indication of the class, the standards for buffalo milk shall apply.

cream.definition: Product of cow or buffalo milk or a combination thereof, free from starch and other foreign ingredients.
cream.note: Cream sold without indication of milk fat content shall be treated as high fat cream.

cream_powder.definition: Product obtained by partial removal of water from cream. Fat/protein content may be adjusted. Shall have uniform color and pleasant taste/flavor. Free from vegetable oil/fat, mineral oil, added flavor, and any substance foreign to milk.

malai.definition: Product rich in butter fat prepared by boiling and cooling cow or buffalo milk or a combination thereof.

dahi_or_curd.definition: Product from pasteurised or boiled milk by souring with harmless lactic acid or other bacterial cultures. May contain added cane sugar.

requirements.milk_fat_and_solids_not_fat_min_percenta: Same as the milk from which it is prepared.

dahi_or_curd.note: If sold without an indication of class of milk, the standards for dahi prepared from buffalo milk shall apply.

chhana_or_paneer.definition: Product obtained from cow or buffalo milk by precipitation with sour milk, lactic acid or citric acid.

low_fat_paneer_or_chhana.packaging: Shall be sold in a sealed package with proper label declaration.

cheese.definition: Ripened or unripened soft, semi-hard, hard and extra hard product, obtained by coagulating milk. May contain starter cultures, enzymes and sodium chloride.

types.name: Ripened Cheese
types.definition: Not ready for consumption shortly after manufacture, requires holding for biochemical changes.

types.name: Mould Ripened cheese
types.definition: Ripening accomplished primarily by characteristic mould growth inside or on the surface.

types.name: Unripened cheese including fresh cheese
types.definition: Ready for consumption shortly after manufacture.

general_requirements.taste_and_flavor: Pleasant, free from off-flavor and rancidity.

processed_cheese.definition: Product obtained by grinding, mixing, melting and emulsifying one or more varieties of cheeses with heat and emulsifying agents. May contain other ingredients like cream, butter, etc.
processed_cheese.note: Processed cheese chiplets (packed sliced cheese) shall not contain more than 50.0% moisture.

processed_cheese_spread.definition: Product obtained by grinding, mixing, melting and emulsifying one or more varieties of cheese with heat and emulsifying agents. May contain various ingredients like cream, sugars, spices, etc.

specific_cheese_types.name: Cheddar Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with lactic acid bacteria and rennet. Hard pressed block, waxy texture, pale straw to orange color.

specific_cheese_types.name: Danbo Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with lactic acid bacteria and rennet. Smooth appearance, firm texture, uniform yellow color.

specific_cheese_types.name: Edam Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk. Firm texture, yellowish color, hard rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Gouda Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk. Firm texture, straw to yellowish color, hard rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Havarti Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk. Firm texture, light yellow color, may have a greasy rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Tilsiter
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with lactic acid bacteria and Bacterium linens. Firm texture, ivory to yellow color, firm rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Cottage Cheese and Creamed Cottage Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulation of pasteurised skimmed milk. Creamed Cottage Cheese has a creaming mixture added. Soft texture, natural white color.

specific_cheese_types.name: Cream Cheese (Rahmfrischkase)
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulation of pasteurised milk and cream. Soft smooth texture, white to light cream color.

specific_cheese_types.name: Coulommiers Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulation of milk with lactic acid bacteria, rennet, and moulds. Soft texture, white to cream yellow color.

specific_cheese_types.name: Camembert Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with specific cultures. Flat cylindrical shape with white mould.

specific_cheese_types.name: Brie Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with specific cultures. White to creamy yellow color, smooth texture with white mould on rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Saint Paulin
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with rennet and lactic acid bacteria. White to yellow color, firm and flexible texture, hard rind.

specific_cheese_types.name: Samsoe
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with rennet and lactic acid bacteria. Yellow color, firm texture.

specific_cheese_types.name: Emmentaler
specific_cheese_types.type: Hard ripened cheese with round holes
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with rennet and lactic acid bacteria. Light yellow color, firm texture.
specific_cheese_types.additional_info: May contain Cupric Sulphate not exceeding 15 mgm/Kg.

specific_cheese_types.name: Provolone
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk with cultures and rennet. May be smoked. White to yellow straw color, fibrous or smooth body.

specific_cheese_types.name: Extra Hard Grating Cheese
specific_cheese_types.description: Obtained by coagulating milk. White to light cream color, slightly brittle texture, extra hard rind.

ice_cream.definition: Product obtained by freezing a pasteurized mix from milk and/or other milk products with optional additions like fruits, nuts, etc. Can be frozen hard or soft.

dried_ice_cream_mix.definition: Powder which, when mixed with water, conforms to ice cream standards (except weight/volume).

frozen_dessert_frozen_confection.definition: Product obtained by freezing a pasteurized mix with milk fat and/or edible vegetable oils/fats and proteins.

requirements_table.product: Medium Fat Frozen Dessert/ Frozen Confection
Low Fat Frozen Dessert/ Frozen Confection

milk_ice_or_milk_lolly.definition: Product obtained by freezing a pasteurized mix prepared from milk and/or other milk products with optional additions.

khoya.definition: Product obtained from cow, buffalo, goat or sheep milk or milk solids by rapid drying.
khoya.additives: May contain citric acid (max 0.1%). Shall be free from added starch, sugar, and colouring matter.

evaporated_milk.definition: Product obtained by partial removal of water from milk. Fat and protein content may be adjusted.

sweetened_condensed_milk.definition: Product obtained by partial removal of water from milk with added sugar.

milk_powder.definition: Product obtained by partial removal of water from milk. Fat and protein content may be adjusted.

infant_milk_food.definition: Product prepared by spray drying of cow or buffalo milk, modified with carbohydrates, salts, vitamins and minerals.

requirements_table.characteristic: Ash insoluble in dilute Hydrochloric acid

requirements_table.limit: Not less than 2.5 and not more than 5.0

infant_formula.definition: Product prepared by spray drying milk of cow or buffalo or a mixture thereof, with partial replacement of milk fat with vegetable oils rich in polyunsaturated fatty acids.

requirements_table.characteristic: Ash insoluble in dilute Hydrochloric acid

lactose_free_infant_milk_substitute.description: Edible vegetable oil may be used in place of milk fat and lecithin as an emulsifier. Soy protein-based or cow's/buffalo's milk-based with specific carbohydrates.

hypoallergenic_infant_milk_substitutes.protein_source: Hydrolyzed whey or casein or 100% free amino acids.

milk_cereal_based_complementary_food.definition: Foods based on milk, cereal and/or legumes (pulses), soyabean, millets, nuts and edible oil seeds. Intended to supplement diet for infants after six months.

processed_cereal_based_complementary_foo.definition: Foods based on cereal and/or legumes, soyabean, millets, nuts and edible oil seeds. Intended for infants after six months up to two years.

follow_up_formula_complementary_food.definition: Product prepared by spray drying milk of cow or buffalo or a mixture thereof, for infants after six months and up to two years. Provides 60-85 kcal per 100 ml ready-for-consumption.

butter.definition: Fatty product derived exclusively from milk of cow and/or buffalo. May contain common salt and starter cultures. Table butter shall be from pasteurised milk.
butter.note: If sold without indication of class, standards for table butter apply.

ghee.definition: Pure clarified fat derived solely from milk or curd or from desi butter or cream. No colouring or preservative added. Standards vary by state/union territory.

standards_table.sub_region: Areas other than cotton tract areas
Areas other than cotton tract areas
Areas other than cotton tract areas
Areas other than cotton tract areas
Areas other than Bishnupur sub division

ghee.explanation: Cotton tract means areas where cotton seed is extensively fed to cattle.

milkfat_butter_oil_and_anhydrous_milk_fa.definition: Fatty products derived exclusively from milk with almost total removal of water and solids not fat.

requirements_table.product: Anhydrous milk fat/ Anhydrous Butter Oil

chakka.definition: White to pale yellow semi-solid product from yoghurt by draining whey. Good texture and consistency. Free from foreign ingredients, mouldness, seepage, extraneous color and flavors.

shrikhand.definition: Product obtained from chakka with added milk fat. May contain fruits, nuts, sugar, cardamom, saffron and other spices. No added coloring and artificial flavoring.

yoghurt.definition: Coagulated product from pasteurised milk/cream by lactic acid fermentation using Lactobacillus bulgaricus and Streptococcus thermophilus. May contain other cultures. Shall be viable and abundant.
yoghurt.note: Heat treated yoghurt shall be labeled accordingly and conform to standards except for bacterial count.

whey_powder.definition: Product obtained by drying sweet or acid whey. Uniform color, pleasant taste/flavor.

edible_casein_products.definition: Products obtained by separating, washing and drying the coagulum of skimmed milk.

oils.general_requirements_refined_oils: Refined vegetable oil shall be clear and free from rancidity, adulterants, sediments, suspended and other foreign matter, separated water, added colouring and flavouring substances and mineral oil. Test for argemone oil shall be negative. The refined oil shall not contain Hexane more than 5.00 ppm. The oil must be obtained from one of the listed vegetable oils. Moisture shall not exceed 0.10%.

cotton_seed_oil_binola_ka_tel.source: Delinted and decorticated cotton seeds (genus Gossypium)

mahua_oil.source: Seeds or nuts of Madhuca (Bassi latifolia or B. longifolia)

rapeseed_or_mustard_oil_low_erucic_acid.source: Low erucic acid oil bearing seeds of Brassica

olive_oil.source: Fruit of the olive tree (Olea europaea sativa Hoffm. et Link)

types.definition: Obtained by mechanical or physical means. Suitable for consumption in natural state.
Obtained from virgin olive oil by refining methods without altering glyceridic structure.
Obtained from 'olive pomace' by solvent extraction and refining.

maize_corn_oil.source: Germ of clean and sound seeds of zea mays linn.

refined_vegetable_oil.definition: Any vegetable oil obtained by expression or solvent extraction and refined.

almond_oil.source: Seeds of prunus amygdalus Batach, var, dulcis koehne (sweet almond) or of Prunus amygdalus Batach, var Amara Focke (bitter almond)

water_melon_seed_oil.source: Clean, sound seeds of the fruit of water-melon (citrullus vulgaris schrad)

palm_oil.source: Fleshy mesocarp of fruits of the oil palm (Elaeis Guinensis)
palm_oil.special_notes: Indigenously produced raw palm oil can have acid value up to 6.0. Imported or solvent-extracted palm oil must be refined and conform to standards for refined vegetable oil.

palm_kernel_oil.source: Sound kernel of the fruits of oil palm (Elaeis guinensis)

sun_flower_seed_oil.source: Clean and sound sunflower seeds or cake (Helianthus annus linn)

sunflowerseed_oil_and_sunflowerseed_oil_.source: Clean and sound Sunflowerseed or the High Oleic acid oil bearing Sunflowerseeds (Helianthus annuus L.)

rice_bran_oil.source: Layer around the endosperm of rice from paddy (Oryza Sativa Linn.)

blended_edible_vegetable_oil.definition: Admixture of any two edible vegetable oils, with proportion of each being at least 20%.
blended_edible_vegetable_oil.general_requirements: Clear, free from rancidity, foreign matter, etc. Individual oils must conform to their respective standards.

interesterified_vegetable_fat.definition: Edible fatty material treated to rearrange fatty acid positions, changing physical properties.

requirements_table.product: Partially hydrogenated and winterised soyabean oil

partially_hydrogenated_soyabean_oil.note: All edible oils shall be free from Castor oil.

cocoa_butter.source: Nibs of the beans of Theobroma cocoa L.

refined_salseed_fat.source: Seed kernels of sal trees, shorea robusta Gaertn.

dhupa_fat.source: Seed kernels of Dhupa (Vateria Indica Linn) tree

phulwara_fat.source: Seed kernels of Phulwara [Aisandra Butyrace (Roxb) Baelni, Madhuca Butyracea or Bassia Butyracea]

table_margarine.definition: Emulsion of edible oils and fats with water. Free from rancidity, mineral oil, animal body fats.

bakery_and_industrial_margarine.definition: Emulsion of vegetable oil product with water. Free from added color and flavor, rancidity, mineral oil, animal body fats.

fat_spread.definition: Water in oil emulsion of edible oils and fats, excluding animal body fats.

classifications.characteristics: Fat content is exclusively milk fat.
Fat content is a mixture of milk fat with other fats.
Fat content is a mixture of any two or more hydrogenated, unhydrogenated, or interesterified vegetable oils.

fat_spread.labeling: Fat content must be declared. In mixed fat spread, milk fat content must also be declared. The word 'butter' shall not be used.

vanaspati.definition: Any refined edible vegetable oil or oils, subjected to a process of hydrogenation.

special_provisions.sal_seed_fat_limit: Not more than 10% of the total oil mix.
special_provisions.imported_palm_oil_provision: Imported crude palm oil and its fractions must be used for vanaspati/hydrogenated oil production only by manufacturers with on-site hydrogen generation and hydrogenation facilities.

general_requirements.harmful_substances: Shall not contain any harmful colouring, flavouring or matter deleterious to health.
general_requirements.color: No color resembling ghee shall be added.
general_requirements.flavor: If flavor is used, it must be distinct from ghee, from a list of permissible flavors.
general_requirements.diacetyl_for_armed_forces: Diacetyl (max 4.0 ppm) may be added to vanaspati for the Armed Forces.
general_requirements.appearance_and_taste: On melting, shall be clear, free from staleness or rancidity, with pleasant taste and smell.
general_requirements.sesame_oil_test: Shall contain sufficient raw or refined sesame (til) oil so that when mixed with refined groundnut oil (20:80), the Baudouin test is not lighter than 2.0 red units.
general_requirements.additives: No anti-oxidant, synergist, emulsifier, or other such substance shall be added without prior sanction of the Authority.

bakery_shortening.definition: Vanaspati used as a shortening or leavening agent for bakery products.
bakery_shortening.general_requirements: Conforms to Vanaspati standards, with exceptions.

exceptions.aeration: Only nitrogen, air, or inert gas may be used. Quantity shall not exceed 12% by volume.
exceptions.emulsifiers: May contain added mono-glycerides and diglycerides.

container_filling_standards.description: For all rigid containers, the product shall occupy not less than 90.0% of the water capacity of the container. Water capacity is the volume of distilled water at 20°C that a sealed container can hold.
container_filling_standards.note: This is a recurring standard for many products.

thermally_processed_fruits.definition: Products obtained from sound, matured, fresh, dehydrated or frozen fruits, processed by heat to prevent spoilage.

thermally_processed_fruit_cocktail.definition: Product from a mixture of fresh, frozen, dehydrated or processed fruits, processed by heat to prevent spoilage.

thermally_processed_vegetables.definition: Product from fresh, dehydrated or frozen vegetables, processed by heat to prevent spoilage.

thermally_processed_curried_vegetables_r.definition: Product prepared from various vegetables, legumes, cereals or pulses, processed by heat to prevent spoilage.
thermally_processed_curried_vegetables_r.composition: May contain salt, sweeteners, spices, edible vegetable oils, milk fat, etc.

thermally_processed_vegetable_soups.definition: Unfermented product from juice/pulp/puree of vegetables, cooked and heat processed to prevent spoilage.

thermally_processed_fruit_juices.definition: Unfermented, pulpy, turbid or clear juice from ripe fruit, processed by heat. May be reconstituted from concentrate.
thermally_processed_fruit_juices.sweeteners: May contain nutritive sweeteners (up to 50 g/kg, or 200 g/kg in very acidic fruits). Not called 'sweetened' if added sweeteners do not exceed 15 g/kg.

requirements_table.product: Mango, Guava or any other pulp fruit
Other fruit juices of single species - not very acidic
Other fruit juices of single species - very acidic
Other fruit juices of single species or combination thereof - not very acidic
Other fruit juices of single species or combination thereof - very acidic

thermally_processed_vegetable_juices.definition: Unfermented or lactic acid fermented product from edible parts of vegetables, processed by heat.

thermally_processed_tomato_juice.definition: Unfermented juice from ripe tomatoes, processed by heat. Free from skin, seeds, and coarse parts.

thermally_processed_fruit_nectars.definition: Unfermented, pulpy or non-pulpy product from fruit juice/pulp, blended with water and sweeteners and processed by heat.

requirements_table.product: Other Fruit Nectars of High Acidity/Pulpy / Strong flavour

thermally_processed_fruit_beverages_frui.definition: Unfermented product from fruit juice/pulp/puree with water and other ingredients, heat processed.

thermally_processed_mango_pulp_puree.definition: Unfermented product from ripe mangoes, heat processed.

thermally_processed_fruit_pulp_puree_oth.definition: Unfermented product from ripe fruit, heat processed.
thermally_processed_fruit_pulp_puree_oth.sweeteners: May be described as sweetened if nutritive sweeteners exceed 15g/kg.

thermally_processed_concentrated_fruit_v.definition: Unfermented, fermentable product from fruit/vegetable juice, pulp, or puree, from which water has been removed to at least double the original soluble content.

thermally_processed_tomato_puree_and_pas.definition: Unfermented product obtained by concentrating tomato juice.

soup_powders.definition: Product obtained by mechanical dehydration of fruit/vegetable juice, pulp, or puree.

fruit_vegetable_juice_pulp_puree_with_pr.definition: Unfermented, fermentable product from fruit/vegetable juice, pulp, or puree, preserved for industrial use.

concentrated_fruit_vegetable_juice_pulp_.definition: Unfermented, fermentable product from fruit/vegetable juice, pulp, or puree with water removed to at least double the original soluble content.

tamarind_pulp_puree_and_concentrate.definition: Unfermented, fermentable product from tamarind, preserved by thermal processing or preservatives.

fruit_bar_toffee.definition: Product from fruit pulp/puree blended with sweeteners and fats, dehydrated into a sheet.

fruit_vegetable_cereal_flakes.definition: Product from fruit/vegetable pulp/puree blended with starch, cereals, and sweeteners, dehydrated into flakes.

squashes_crushes_fruit_syrups_fruit_shar.definition: Products from unfermented fruit juice/puree blended with sweeteners, water, and other ingredients.
squashes_crushes_fruit_syrups_fruit_shar.notes: Syrups/sharbats with a minimum of 10% dry fruits can be called fruit syrups.

ginger_cocktail.definition: Product from ginger juice, oleoresin, or essence with water and sweeteners.

synthetic_syrup_for_use_in_dispensers_fo.definition: Syrup for carbonated water, blending sweeteners with water and other ingredients.

synthetic_syrup_or_sharbat.definition: Syrup from sugar, dextrose, or liquid glucose. May contain fruit juice.

murabba.definition: Product prepared from fruits, rhizomes, or vegetables by impregnating with sweeteners to preserve.

definitions.candied: Product from fruits/vegetables impregnated with sweeteners.
definitions.crystallised: Candied product coated with crystallized sugar.
definitions.glazed: Candied product coated with a thin layer of heavy syrup.

tomato_ketchup_and_tomato_sauce.definition: Product from tomato juice/puree/paste blended with sweeteners, salt, vinegar, spices, and condiments.

culinary_pastes_fruits_and_vegetable_sau.definition: Culinary preparation from edible fruits/vegetables, cooked with sweeteners, salt, spices, etc.

soyabean_sauce.definition: Product from fermented soyabean paste blended with salt and sweeteners.

carbonated_fruit_beverages_or_fruit_drin.definition: Beverage from fruit juice and carbonated water with sugar and other ingredients.

jam.definition: Product from fruit pieces or pulp/puree boiled with sweeteners to a suitable consistency.

fruit_jelly.definition: Product from fruit juice boiled with sweeteners and concentrated to gelatinize on cooling.

fruit_cheese.definition: Product from fruit pulp/puree cooked with salt and sweeteners to a thick consistency that sets on cooling.

marmalades.definition: Product from fruit, peel, pulp, and juice boiled with sweeteners to gelatinize on cooling.

dehydrated_fruits.definition: Product from edible parts of fruits with moisture removed to preserve it.

dehydrated_vegetables.definition: Product from edible portions of vegetables with moisture removed to preserve it.

requirements_table.name: Tubers (Arvi, Lotus Root Tapioca, Yam, Carrot, Potato)
Powders of other vegetables including tomatoes

frozen_fruits_fruit_products.definition: Product from fresh, sound fruits, quick frozen to -18°C or colder.

frozen_vegetables.definition: Product from sound, clean vegetables, quick frozen to -18°C or colder.

frozen_curried_vegetables_ready_to_eat_v.definition: Product from vegetables, legumes, cereals or pulses, frozen to -18°C or colder.

fruit_based_beverage_mix_powdered_fruit_.definition: Powdered product for dilution, from fruit solids with sweeteners and other ingredients.

fruits_and_vegetable_chutney.definition: Product from cooked fruits and/or vegetables with sweeteners, preserved by thermal processing or other means.

mango_chutney.definition: Product from cooked mangoes with sweeteners, preserved by thermal processing or other means.

pickles.definition: Preparation from fruits or vegetables preserved in salt, acid, sugar, or a combination.

table_olives.definition: Product from sound, clean olive fruits, processed and preserved.

requirements_table.product: Green olives with natural lactic fermentation

grated_desiccated_coconut.definition: Product from peeled, milled, and dried coconut kernel.

brewed_vinegar.definition: Product from alcoholic and acetic acid fermentation of suitable mediums. Not fortified with acetic acid.

requirements.prohibited_substances: Sulphuric acid, other mineral acids, foreign substances, colouring matter except caramel.

synthetic_vinegar.definition: Product from acetic acid with or without caramel and spices.

requirements.prohibited_substances: Sulphuric acid, other mineral acids, foreign substances, colouring matter except caramel.

synthetic_vinegar.labeling: Must be distinctly labeled as 'SYNTHETIC - PREPARED FROM ACETIC ACID'.

groundnut_kernel_deshelled.definition: Kernels from the plant arachis hypogols, for direct human consumption.
groundnut_kernel_deshelled.prohibited_substances: Non-edible seeds like mahua, caster, neem or argemone, coloring matter, and preservatives.

raisins.definition: Dried sound, clean grapes of proper maturity. May be with or without seeds and stems, and bleached with Sulphur Dioxide.

pistachio_nuts.definition: Mature seeds of Pistacia vera L with naturally or mechanically opened shells. May be raw, roasted, or salted.

dates.definition: Dried sound, clean fruits of proper maturity from Phoenix dactylifera. May be treated with sugar, glucose syrup, flour, and vegetable oil.

dry_fruits_and_nuts.definition: Products from dried sound, clean fruits and nuts of proper maturity.

bean.definition: Dry kidney shaped or flattened seeds of leguminous varieties.

atta.definition: Coarse product from milling or grinding clean wheat.

fortified_atta.definition: Atta with added calcium carbonate, iron, thiamine, riboflavin, and niacin.

protein_rich_paushtik_atta.definition: Wheat atta mixed with up to 10% groundnut or soya flour or a combination.

maida.definition: Fine product from milling and bolting clean wheat.

fortified_maida.definition: Maida with added calcium carbonate, iron, thiamine, riboflavin, and niacin.

protein_rich_paushtik_maida.definition: Maida mixed with up to 10% groundnut or soya flour or a combination.

semolina_suji_or_rawa.definition: Product from grinding and bolting clean wheat.

besan.definition: Product from grinding dehusked Bengal gram.

pearl_barley_jau.definition: Product from sound and clean barley. Free from fermented, musty taste/odour, adulterants, insect/fungus infestation, and rodent contamination.

barley_powder.definition: Product from grinding clean and sound dehusked barley grains.

wholemeal_barley_powder_or_barley_flour_.definition: Product from grinding clean and sound dehusked barley grains.

food_grains_general_standards.definition: Whole or broken kernels of cereals, millets and pulses.
food_grains_general_standards.prohibited_substances: Argemone, Maxicana and Kesari in any form, added colouring matter, insecticide residues beyond specified limits.

food_grains_specific_standards.grain: Any other foodgrains not specified above

cornflour_maize_starch.definition: Starch obtained from maize (zea mays L.).

corn_flakes.definition: Product from dehulled, degermed and cooked corn by flaking and toasting.

custard_powder.definition: Product from maize or sago/topioca with other starches and ingredients.

macaroni_products.definition: Products like macaroni, spaghetti, vermicelli from suji or maida with other ingredients.

malted_milk_food.definition: Product from mixing milk or milk powder with wort from malted cereals and wheat flour, prepared in a powder or granule form.
malted_milk_food.microbiological_requirements: Yeast and mould, Salmonella and Shigella, E.Coli, Vibrio cholera and V.Paraheamolyticus, Faecal streptococci and Staphylococcus aureas are all to be absent in specified quantities.

malt_based_foods_malt_food.definition: Product from mixing malt with other cereal and legume flour, with or without milk or other ingredients.

rolled_oats.definition: Product from sound hulled oats, in the form of crisp flakes.

solvent_extract_soya_flour.definition: Product from clean soyabeans, cracked, dehulled, solvent extracted with food grade hexane and ground.

solvent_extracted_groundnut_flour.definition: Product from fresh, clean, degermed groundnut kernels, extracted with food grade hexane.

solvent_extracted_sesame_flour.definition: Product from pressed, clean sesame seeds, solvent extracted with food grade hexane.

solvent_extracted_coconut_flour.definition: Product from fresh coconut kernels or dried copra, extracted with food grade hexane.

solvent_extracted_cotton_seed_flour.definition: Product from solvent extraction of oil from oil cake from cotton seed.

starchy_foods.arrowroot: Separated and purified starch from the rhizomes of Maranta arundinacea or Curcuma augustifolia.

sago.definition: Small hard globules or pearls from the starch of the sago palm or tapioca tubers.

biscuits_including_wafer_biscuits.definition: Made from maida, vanaspati or other fats/oils, with various ingredients.

bread.definition: Product from a mixture of wheat atta, maida, water, salt, yeast, and other ingredients.

definitions.animal: Ovines, Caprines, Suillines, Bovines, poultry, and fish.
definitions.carcass: Dead body or any part of an animal slaughtered for human consumption.
definitions.meat: Flesh and other edible parts of a carcass.
definitions.meat_food_products: Articles of food from meat, prepared by drying, curing, smoking, cooking, etc., with specific exclusions.
definitions.slaughter_house: Licensed building for the slaughter of animals for human consumption.

canned_corned_beef.definition: Product from boneless meat of bovine animals, uniformly cured and heat treated.
canned_corned_beef.ingredients: Edible common salt, sodium/potassium nitrite. May contain ascorbic acid/isoascorbate acid and their sodium salts (max 500 mg/kg), nutritive sweeteners.

canned_luncheon_meat.definition: Product from edible meat of mammalian animals or poultry, uniformly cured and heat treated.
canned_luncheon_meat.ingredients: Edible common salt, sodium/potassium nitrite. May be with or without binders, spices, seasonings, flavor enhancers, ascorbic acid/isoascorbic acid (max 500 mg/kg), and sodium/potassium mono-di-polyphosphates (max 3000 mg/kg).

canned_cooked_ham.definition: Product from meat of pigs, free from bones, cartilage, tendons, and ligaments. Uniformly cured and heat treated.
canned_cooked_ham.ingredients: Edible common salt, sodium/potassium nitrite. May contain sweeteners, spices, gelatin, flavor enhancers, ascorbic acid/isoascorbic acid (max 500 mg/kg), sodium/potassium mono-di-polyphosphates (max 3000 mg/kg), and other emulsifying/stabilizing agents.

canned_chopped_meat.definition: Product from edible meat of mammalian animals or poultry, uniformly cured and heat treated.
canned_chopped_meat.ingredients: Edible common salt, sodium/potassium nitrite. May be with or without binders, spices, seasonings, flavor enhancers, ascorbic acid/isoascorbic acid (max 500 mg/kg), and sodium/potassium mono-di-polyphosphates (max 3000 mg/kg).

canned_chicken.definition: Product from edible meat of poultry, free from bones, blood clots, skin, etc. Cured with salt and sodium nitrite.
canned_chicken.requirements: Free from added color, flavor, and meat tenderizer. Heat treated to be shelf stable.

canned_mutton_and_goat_meat.definition: Product from edible meat of sheep and goat, free from bones, blood clots, skin, etc. Cured with salt and sodium nitrate/nitrite.
canned_mutton_and_goat_meat.requirements: Free from added color, flavor, and meat tenderizer. Heat treated to be shelf stable.

frozen_mutton_chicken_goat_and_buffalo_m.definition: Product from edible meat of specified animals, quickly frozen to -18°C or colder.

frozen_shrimps_or_prawns.definition: Product from fresh shrimps of sound quality, frozen to -18°C or colder. May be peeled, unpeeled, raw or cooked.

frozen_lobsters.definition: Product from fresh lobsters of sound quality, frozen to -18°C or colder. May be raw or cooked.

frozen_squid_and_parts_of_squid.definition: Product from fresh squid of sound quality, frozen to -18°C or colder.

frozen_finfish.definition: Product from fresh fish of good quality, frozen to -18°C or colder.

frozen_fish_fillets_or_minced_fish_flesh.definition: Products from fresh wholesome fish, frozen to -18°C or colder.

dried_shark_fins.definition: Product from fins of fresh shark, dried.

salted_fish_dried_salted_fish.definition: Product from fresh wholesome fish, saturated with salt and dried.

canned_finfish.definition: Product from flesh of fresh finfish, packed and heat treated for commercial sterility.

canned_shrimp.definition: Product from fresh shrimp with head, shell, and antenna removed, packed and heat treated.

canned_sardines_or_sardine_type_products.definition: Product from fresh or frozen fish of specific species, packed and heat treated.

canned_salmon.definition: Product from fresh fish of specific species, packed and heat treated.

canned_crab_meat.definition: Product from live crabs, packed and heat treated.

canned_tuna_and_bonito.definition: Product from fresh fish of specific species, packed and heat treated.

sugar_boiled_confectionery.definition: Processed food from boiled sugar with or without doctoring agents. May have center filling or coating.
sugar_boiled_confectionery.ingredients: Sugar, invert sugar, jaggery, milk, edible molasses, starches, fats, nuts, cocoa, vitamins, etc.

lozenges.definition: Confections from pulverized sugar with binding materials, made by cold mixing.

chewing_gum_and_bubble_gum.definition: Prepared from gum base, sugar, and liquid glucose.

chocolate.definition: Homogeneous product from cocoa beans, cocoa nib, etc., with or without sugar, milk solids, and cocoa butter. No vegetable fat other than cocoa butter.

requirements_table.unit: per cent by weight, Not less than
per cent by weight, Not less than
(on Moisture-free and fat free basis) percent by weight Not less than
(on Moisture-free and fat-free basis) percent by weight. Not less than
(on moisture fat and sugar free basis) percent by weight. Not more than

ice_lollies_or_edible_ices.definition: Frozen ice product containing sugar, syrup, fruit, etc. No artificial sweetener.

ice_candy.definition: Product from freezing a pasteurized mix of water, sweeteners, fruits, and other ingredients.

plantation_white_sugar.definition: Crystallised product from sugarcane or sugar beet.

refined_sugar.definition: White crystallised sugar from refining plantation white sugar.

khandsari_sugar.definition: Obtained from sugarcane juice by open pan process. Two varieties: Desi and Sulphur Sugar.

bura_sugar.definition: Fine grain size product from any kind of sugar.

cube_sugar.definition: Sugar in the form of cubes from refined crystallised sugar.

icing_sugar.definition: Sugar manufactured by pulverizing refined sugar or vacuum pan sugar with or without edible starch.

misri.definition: Product in candy form from sugar or palmyrah juice.

honey.definition: Natural sweet substance produced by honey bees from nectar or plant secretions.

gur_or_jaggery.definition: Product from boiling or processing sugarcane or palm juice.

dextrose.definition: White or light cream granular powder.

requirements.acidity: Not more than 0.20 ml of N/10 sodium hydroxide to neutralize 0.5 gm.

dried_glucose_syrup.definition: White to creamish white powder, sweet to taste.

saccharin_sodium.definition: Commonly known as soluble Saccharin, with empirical formula C7 H4 NNaO3S.2H2O.

aspartyl_phenylalanine_methyl_ester_aspe.definition: Commonly known as Aspertame, with empirical formula C14 H18 N2 O5.

acesulfame_potassium.description: Odourless, white crystalline powder, intensely sweet taste, very slightly soluble in ethanol but freely soluble in water.

sucralose.description: White to off-white, odourless, crystalline powder with a sweet taste. Freely soluble in water, methanol, and alcohol; slightly soluble in ethyl acetate.

notes: Extraneous matter is classified as organic (chaff, stems) and inorganic (dust, stones), with inorganic not exceeding 2% by weight of the total.
microbiological_standards: All spices, condiments, and related products from 2.9.1 to 2.9.29 must conform to microbiological requirements in Table 3 of Appendix B.

caraway_siahjira_whole.mericarps: Carum carvi L. (Blond Caraway) or Carum bulbocastanum (Black Caraway)

caraway_siahjira_powder.source: Dried mature fruit of Carum Carvi L.

small_cardamom_chhoti_elaichi_whole.source: Dried capsules of Elettaria cardamomum L. Maton Var. Minuscula Burkill

small_cardamom_chhoti_elaichi_seeds.source: Decorticated seeds of Elettaria Cardamomum L. Maton var miniscula Burkill

small_cardamom_chhoti_elaichi_powder.source: Dried seeds of Elettaria Cardamomum L. Maton var miniscula Burkill

large_cardamom_badi_elaichi_whole.source: Dried nearly ripe fruit of Amomum subulatum Roxb.

large_cardamom_badi_elaichi_seeds.source: Seeds from decorticated capsules of Amomum subulatum Roxb.

large_cardamom_badi_elaichi_powder.source: Ground seeds of Amomum subulatum Roxb.

whole.source: Dried ripe fruits or pods of Capsicum annum L & Capsicum frutescens L.

powder.source: Ground clean ripe fruits or pods of Capsicum annum L and Capsicum frutescens L.

whole.source: Inner bark of trunks or branches of Cinnamomum Zeylanicum Blume.

powder.source: Ground inner bark of Cinnamomum Zeylanicum Blume.

whole.source: Bark of trees of Cinnamomum Cassia (Nees) ex Blume, Cinnamomum aromaticum, Cinnamomum burmanii and Cinnamomum loureini Nees.

powder.source: Ground bark of Cinnamomum Cassia (Nees) ex Blume, Cinnamomum aromaticum, Cinnamomum burmanii and Cinnamomum loureini Nees.

whole.source: Dried unopened flower buds of Eugenia Caryophyllus (C. Sprengel) Bullock and Harrision.

powder.source: Ground dried unopened flower buds of Eugenia Caryophyllus (C. Sprengel) Bullock and Harrision.

whole.source: Dried mature fruits (seeds) of Coriandrum sativum L.

powder.source: Ground dried mature fruits of Coriandrum sativum L.

white_cumin_safed_zeera_whole.source: Dried mature fruits of Cuminum Cyminum L.

white_cumin_safed_zeera_powder.source: Ground dried mature seeds of Cuminum Cyminum L.

black_cumin_kalonji_powder.source: Ground dried seeds of Nigella sativa L.

whole.source: Dried ripe fruit of Foeniculum vulgare P. Miller Var. Vulgare.

powder.source: Ground ripe fruits (seeds) of Foeniculum Vulgare P. Miller Var Vulgare.

whole.source: Dried mature seeds of Trigonella foenum graecum L.

powder.source: Ground dried mature seeds of Trigonella foenum graecum L.

whole.source: Dried rhizome of Zingiber officinale Roscoe.

powder.source: Ground rhizome of Zingiber officinale Roscoe.

whole.source: Dried coat or aril of the seed of Myristica fragrans Houttuyn.

powder.source: Ground dried coat or aril of the seed of Myristica fragrans Houttuyn.

whole.source: Dried, clean mature seeds of Brassica species.

powder.source: Ground dried, clean mature seeds of Brassica species.

whole.source: Dried seed (kernel) of Myristica fragrans Houttuyn.

powder.source: Ground dried seeds (kernel) of Myristica fragrans Houttuyn.

whole.source: Dried berries of Piper nigrum L.

powder.source: Ground dried berries of Piper nigrum L.

light_black_pepper.source: Dried berries of Piper nigrum L.

pinheads.source: Derived from the spikes of piper nigrum L.

whole.source: Dried mature seeds of Papaver somniferum L.
Dried stigmas or tops of styles of Crocus Sativus Linnaeus.

powder.source: Crushed dried stigmas of Crocus Sativus Linnaeus.

whole.source: Primary or secondary rhizomes of Curcuma Longa L.

powder.source: Ground dried rhizomes or bulbous roots of Curcuma Longa L.

curry_powder.definition: Powder from grinding clean, dried, and sound spices from the specified group.

mixed_masala_whole.definition: Mixture of clean, dried, and sound aromatic herbs and spices.

whole.source: Dried and mature fruit of Pimpinella anisum L.
Dried ripe fruits (seeds) of Trachyspermum ammi. L Sprague.

dried_mango_slices.definition: Dried wholesome, edible part of raw mango fruit.

dried_mango_powder_amchur.definition: Powder from grinding dried mango slices.

whole.source: Dried berries of Piper nigrum L. with outer pericap removed.

powder.source: Ground dried berries of Piper nigrum L. with outer pericarp removed.

dried_dehydrated_garlic.source: Dried cloves of Allium sativum L.

whole.source: Dried ripe fruits (seeds) of Apium graveoleans L.

dehydrated_onion_sukha_pyaj.definition: Product from drying sound bulbs of Allium cepa.L.

compounded_asafoetida_bandhani_hing.definition: Mixture of asafoetida with gum arabic, edible starches or cereal flour.
compounded_asafoetida_bandhani_hing.prohibited_substances: colophony resin, galbanum resin, ammoniaccum resin, other foreign resin, coal tar dyes, mineral pigment.

edible_common_salt.definition: Crystalline solid, white, pale, pink or light grey, free from contamination.

iodised_salt.definition: Crystalline salt, white or pale, pink or light grey, with iodine added.

potassium_iodate.definition: Crystalline powder, white in color, free from impurities.

iron_fortified_iodized_salt_double_forti.definition: Crushed Crystalline Solid, with iron and iodine added.

tea.definition: Tea from leaves, buds, and tender stems of Camellia sinensis (L) O. Kuntze.

kangra_tea.definition: Tea from Camellia sinensis grown in Kangra and Mandi valleys of Himachal Pradesh.

green_tea.definition: Product from leaves, buds, and tender stems of Camellia sinensis (L) O. Kuntze.

coffee.coffee_green_raw_or_unroasted: Dried seeds of Coffea species with husks removed.
coffee.roasted_coffee: Properly cleaned green coffee roasted to a brown color.
coffee.ground_coffee: Powdered product from 'roasted coffee' only, free from husk.

soluble_coffee_powder.definition: Coffee powder from freshly roasted and ground pure coffee beans.

chicory.definition: Roasted chicory powder from cleaned and dried roots of chicorium intybus Lin.

coffee_chicory_mixture_powder.definition: Roasted and ground coffee and chicory mixture.

instant_coffee_chicory_mixture.definition: Product manufactured from roasted and ground coffee and chicory.

toddy.definition: Sap from palm trees that has undergone alcoholic fermentation.

carbonated_water.definition: Water conforming to packaged drinking water standards, impregnated with carbon dioxide.
carbonated_water.permitted_ingredients: Sugar, liquid glucose, dextrose, fruit/vegetable extracts, flavors, colors, preservatives, acids, gums, salts, vitamins, caffeine (max 145 ppm), estergum (max 100 ppm), gellan gum, quinine salts (max 100 ppm), and specific artificial sweeteners.

mineral_water.description_and_types: Water from underground sources, characterized by mineral salts, trace elements, and constant composition.
types: Natural Mineral Water Fortified with Carbon Dioxide from the Source

packaged_drinking_water_other_than_miner.definition: Water from surface, underground, or sea water subjected to specific treatments and disinfection.

baking_powder.definition: A combination of sodium bicarbonate and an acid-reacting material, capable of yielding carbon dioxide.

catechu_edible.definition: Dried aqueous extract from the heart-wood of Acacia Catechu.

gelatin.definition: Purified product from partial hydrolysis of collagen from animal tissues.

pan_masala.definition: Food taken with Pan, containing betelnut, lime, coconut, catechu, etc.
pan_masala.prohibited_substances: Added coaltar colouring matter, any other ingredient injurious to health.

low_and_high_fat_cocoa_powder.definition: Partially defatted product from the cocoa bean.

carob_powder.definition: Powder from the roasted pods of carob (Ceratonia Siliqua).

definition: A food that has not been standardized under these regulations.
requirements: Must have a name describing its nature/composition, comply with all regulatory provisions, and meet standards in Appendices A and B.

dose_limits_table.name_of_foods: Semolina (Sooji or Rawa), Wheat, atta and Maida
Meat and Meat Products including Chicken

requirements_for_the_process_of_irradiat: Facilities must be approved and licensed under the Atomic Energy (Control of Irradiation of Food) Rules, 1991. Food cannot be re-irradiated without permission. A certificate of irradiation must be provided.
storage_and_sale_of_irradiated_food: Irradiated food must be sold only in prepackaged conditions.
record_of_irradiation_of_food: An authorized officer must record details such as product name, dose, date, batch number, quantity, and appearance before and after irradiation.

chapter_3_substances_added_to_food.good_manufacturing_practices_gmp: Food additives should be used at the lowest possible level to achieve their effect, reduced as much as possible if they are incidental components, and handled like any other food ingredient.

use_of_food_additives.traditional_foods: May contain permitted additives from Table 2 of Appendix A.
use_of_food_additives.bread_biscuits: May contain permitted additives from Table 1 of Appendix A.
use_of_food_additives.other_foods: A wide range of other foods may contain additives from Table 3 of Appendix A.

colouring_matter.prohibition: Unauthorized addition of colouring matter is prohibited.
colouring_matter.prohibited_inorganic_colours_and_pigment: Inorganic colouring matters and pigments are prohibited unless otherwise provided.
colouring_matter.use_of_lake_colours: Aluminum Lake of Sunset Yellow FCF may be used in powdered dry beverages mix (max 0.04% by weight).
colouring_matter.prohibited_use_of_permitted_synthetic_fo: Use is prohibited in foods not explicitly listed.

artificial_sweeteners.mixture_of_artificial_sweeteners_prohibi: No mixture of artificial sweeteners shall be added to any article of food or in the manufacture of table top sweeteners.
artificial_sweeteners.exceptions_and_conditions: Combinations are permitted in certain products like carbonated water, soft drink concentrate, and synthetic syrup for dispenser, provided the proportionate limits are respected.

class_ii: Nitrates or Nitrites of Sodium or Potassium

preservatives.use_of_more_than_one_class_ii_preservati: Prohibited, with an exception for combined use in certain cases as long as proportionate limits are followed.

use_of_class_ii_preservatives_restricted.non_alcoholic_wines_squashes_etc: Sulphur dioxide (350 ppm) or Benzoic acid (600 ppm)
use_of_class_ii_preservatives_restricted.jams_marmalade_etc: Sulphur dioxide (40 ppm) or Benzoic acid (200 ppm)
use_of_class_ii_preservatives_restricted.pickles_and_chutneys: Benzoic Acid (250 ppm) or Sulphur dioxide (100 ppm)
use_of_class_ii_preservatives_restricted.cheese_or_processed_cheese: Sorbic acid (3000 ppm) or Nisin (12.5 ppm)
use_of_class_ii_preservatives_restricted.fat_spread: Sorbic acid (1000 ppm) or Benzoic acid (1000 ppm) or both

anti_oxidants.restriction_on_use_of_anti_oxidants: No antioxidant other than lecithin, ascorbic acid and tocopherol shall be added to any food unless otherwise provided.

emulsifying_and_stabilising_agents.restriction_on_use: Shall not be used unless specifically permitted. Certain agents are prohibited in milk and cream.
emulsifying_and_stabilising_agents.permitted_in_bakery_products_and_chocola: Polyglycerol esters of fatty acids and Polyglycerol ester of interesterified Ricinoleic acid (max 0.2%).

anticaking_agents.restriction_on_use_of_anticaking_agents: No anticaking agents shall be used unless specifically permitted.

chapter_3_substances_added_to_food.antifoaming_agents_in_edible_oils_and_fa: Dimethyl Polysiloxane (max 10 ppm) may be used.
chapter_3_substances_added_to_food.use_of_release_agents_in_confectionery: Spreadasil silicon spray (Dimethyl Polysiloxane) (max 10 ppm) in finished product.

types: Natural Flavours and Natural Flavouring substances

monosodium_glutamate.use: Added to foods as per GMP level with proper label declaration.
monosodium_glutamate.prohibited_in_foods: Infant foods, milk and milk products, fresh fruits/vegetables/meat/fish, sugar, honey, salt, herbs, spices, natural mineral water, etc.

sequestering_and_buffering_agents.restriction_on_use: Use is restricted to specified foods in concentrations not exceeding specified limits.

use_limits_table.name: Acetic Acid
use_limits_table.food: Acidulant, buffering and neutralizing agents in beverages soft drinks

use_limits_table.name: Calcium Carbonate
use_limits_table.food: As a neutralizer in number of foods

use_limits_table.name: Polyphosphate
use_limits_table.food: Processed cheese, bread, Milk Preparations, Cake Mixes, Protein foods

use_limits_table.name: Calcium Disodium, Ethylene, Diamine tetra acetate
use_limits_table.food: Emulsions, Salad dressing, Sandwich spread or fat Spread

use_limits_table.substances: Ascorbic acid/Iso Ascorbic acid and its salts

chapter_3_substances_added_to_food.carry_over_of_food_additives: Additives can be present in a food from a raw material or ingredient, provided the total amount in the final food does not exceed the permitted maximum limit.

tartrazine.chemical_name: Trisodium salt of 5-hydroxy-1-p- sulphopheny1-4-(p- sulphophenylazo) pyrazol-3-carboxylic acid.
tartrazine.solubility: Soluble in water. Sparingly soluble in Ethanol.

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: mercury, copper and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, and cyanides

sunset_yellow_fcf.solubility: Soluble in water. Sparingly soluble in Ethanol

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: mercury, copper and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, and cyanides

erythrosine.chemical_name: Disodium or dipotassium salt of 2',4', 5', 7', tetraiodo- fluerescein
erythrosine.solubility: Soluble in water. Sparingly soluble in Ethanol

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: mercury, copper and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, and cyanides

indigo_carmine.solubility: Soluble in water. Sparingly soluble in Ethanol

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: mercury, copper and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, and cyanides

beta_carotene.solubility: Soluble in carbon disulphide, benzene and chloroform, moderately soluble in normal hexane, cyclohexane, ether, petroleum ether and oils; practically insoluble in methanol ; insoluble in water.

chlorophyll.synonyms: C.I. Natural Green 3; Lebensmittel Green No.1
chlorophyll.chemical_name: Chlorophyll a - magnesium complex of 1,3,5,8-tetramethyl 4-ethyl- 2-vinyl-9-keto-10 carbomethoxy phorbinphytyl-7-propionate. Chlorophyll b magnesium complex 1,5,8 trimethyl-3-formyl-4-ethyl- 2- vinyl-9-keto-10 carbomethoxyphorbinphytyl-7-propionate
chlorophyll.empirical_formula: Chlorophyll a - C55H72O5N4Mg; Chlorophyll b- C55H70O6N4Mg
chlorophyll.general_requirements: Intensely dark green, aqueous, ethanolic, or oily solution of chlorophyll degradation products. Soluble in ethanol, ether, chloroform and benzene. Insoluble in water.

caramel.definition: Prepared from food grade carbohydrates in the presence of food grade acids, alkalis or salts.
types: Type-I- Plain Caramel (No ammonium or sulphite compounds)
Type - III - Ammonia Process Caramel (Ammonium compounds used)
Type-IV- Ammonia Sulphite Caramel (Both sulphite and ammonium compounds used)

sulphite_compounds: Potassium, Sodium or ammonium Sulphite or Bisulphite

routine_test_requirements.characteristic: Solid content, per cent by mass
Ammonical nitrogen per cent by mass, max.

routine_test_requirements.type_iii_ammonia_process: Max.300 mg/kg & Max.200 mg/kg on equivalent colour basis
routine_test_requirements.type_iv_ammonia_sulphite: Max.1000 mg/kg & Max.250 mg/kg on equivalent colour basis

type_test_requirements.characteristic: Total sulphur Per cent by mass
Total nitrogen, Per cent by mass

type_test_requirements.type_iii_ammonia_process: Max.40 mg/kg & Max. 25 mg/kg on an equivalent colour basis

annatto.code_number: Cl (1975) No. 75120', Cl (1975) Natural Orange 4 EEC No.E-160 b
types: Solution in oil for use in butter and other food products
Solution in water for use in cheese and other food products
annatto.source: Derived only from the plant Bixa orellana L.

riboflavin.solubility: Slightly soluble in water, more soluble in saline solution and in a 10 per cent (w/v) solution of urea, sparingly soluble in alcohol, practically insoluble in chloroform and in solvent ether and soluble in dilute solution of alkali hydroxides.

ponceau_4r.chemical_name: Trisodium salt of 1-(4-sulpho-1-naphtylazo) naphthol-6, 8- disulphonic acid
ponceau_4r.solubility: Soluble in water. Sparingly soluble in Ethanol

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: mercury, selenium and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, and cyanides
mercury, selenium and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons and cyanides

colour_preparation.definition: A preparation containing one or more of the permitted synthetic food colours alongwith diluents and/or filler materials.
permitted_diluents_and_fillers: Sodium carbonate and sodium hydrogen carbonate
Glycerol mono, di and tri acetate

colour_mixtures.definition: A mixture of two or more permitted synthetic food colours without diluents and filler material.

general_requirements_for_preparations_an.total_synthetic_dye_content_declaration: Must be declared on the label with specified tolerance limits.

limits_for_impurities.prohibited_substances: mercury, copper and chromium, aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon, 2-naphthyl aminobenzidine, amino-4-diphenyl (xenylamine) or their derivatives and cyanides

synonyms: C.l. Food Blue FD and C Blue No.1
brilliant_blue_fcf.chemical_name: Disodium salt of alpha 4-(N- ethylbeta sulfobenzylamino)- phenyl] alpha [4-(N-ethyl-3-Sulfonatobenzylimino]cyclohexa- 2, 5-dienylidene] toluene-2-sulfonate

general_requirements.prohibited_substances: aromatic amines, aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons and cyanides

requirements.prohibited_substances: aromatic nitro compounds, aromatic hydrocarbons and cyanides

aluminium_lake_of_sunset_yellow_fcf.chemical_name: Sunset Yellow FCF Aluminium Lake -6, hydroxy-5 (4-sulfophenlyazo)-2 Naphthalenesulphonic acid, Aluminium Lake.
synonyms: FD and C Yellow No. 6, Aluminium Lake (USA)
aluminium_lake_of_sunset_yellow_fcf.sunset_yellow_dye_specifications: Conforms to table 2 of these Regulations.

alumina_used_in_colour.identity: White, odourless, tasteless, amorphous powder consisting essentially of Aluminium hydroxide.

emulsifying_and_stabilizing_agents.name: Di- Acetyl tartaric acid esters of mono and di- glycerides

colours.powdered_soft_drink_concentrate_mix: Titanium Dioxide (100 ppm max), Ponceau 4R, carmoisine, Erythrosine, Tartrazine, Sunset Yellow FCF, Indigo Carmine, Brilliant Blue FCF, fast green FCF (100 ppm maximum)
colours.custard_powder_jelly_crystal_icecandy: Ponceau 4R/ carmoisine/ Erythrosine/ Tartrazine/ Sunset Yellow FCF/ Indigo Carmine/ Brilliant Blue FCF/ fast green FCF (100 ppm maximum)

preservatives.fat_spread: Sorbic acid (1000 ppm max) or Benzoic Acid (1000 ppm max) or both

emulsifiers_stabilisers.dairy_based_drinks: Carageenan, Pectin, Mono diglycerides of fatty acids, lecithin, sodium alginate and calcium alginate, Xantham Gum, Microcrystalline cellulose, Guar Gum (all GMP)
emulsifiers_stabilisers.flavour_emulsion_flavour_paste: Edible Gums (Arabic and Gum ghatti), glycerols esters of wood resins (ester gum) (all GMP)

antioxidants.name: Propyl gallate, ethyl gallate, Octyl gallate, Dodecyl gallate

emulsifying_agents.name: Mono and di glycerides of fatty acids

Sodium sorbate expressed as sorbic acid
